intro: Peracarpa luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon peracarpa, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that split open to release seeds. Peracarpa luzonica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
